intro: Cavendishia chiriquiensis, commonly known as the Chiriquí banana, is a herbaceous plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Musaceae family and is closely related to the banana genus Musa. The plant features large, broad leaves that are typically green with a waxy texture. It produces clusters of small, yellow flowers that develop into elongated, curved fruits. Due to its unique appearance and potential horticultural value, it is of interest to botanists and plant enthusiasts.
